quotes.quote: The more bombers the less room for doves of peace.
Expand Thy wings, celestial Dove, brood o'er our nature's night on our disordered spirits move, and let there now be light.
Great ideas come into the world as gently as doves.
As the hawk is wont to pursue the trembling doves.
Those doves below, the ones utterly cared for, never endangered ones, cannot know tenderness.
A dove will never nest in a burning tree, nor will love ever reside in unforgiving heart.
The dove loves when it quarrels; the wolf hates when it flatters.
The sacred dove a quill did lend From her high-soaring wing.
When a dove begins to associate with crows its feathers remain white but its heart grows black.
Be wise as a serpent and wary as a dove!
We must combine the toughness of the serpent with the softness of the dove, a tough mind and a tender heart.
The Dove, on silver pinions, winged her peaceful way.
The smallest worm will turn being trodden on, and doves will peck in safeguard of their brood.
No doves come from ravens’ eggs.
Seagulls were the souls of dead soldiers. Owls were the souls of women. Doves were the recently departed souls of unmarried girls.
It is not in the entrails of doves that the fall of empires can be read, but in the breeding of secrets and the multiplication of lies.
Don't kill doves in the garden. You kill one and the others won't come.
